messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, good afternoon. I live on New York Ave in Somerset. My husband just came home and when he opened the door, it smelled like gas outside, like in the streets.
Like a natural gas smell?
Yes, that's right. We didn't know who to call to report this, but you can smell it outside. It’s not in the house yet.
Alrighty. What's the address again?
New York Avenue, 830.
We will get the gas company to your home and have someone check it out.
Thank you.
You're welcome. Stay safe.
Control, I can definitely smell natural gas in the area before I even get out of my car.
Really? Is it a very strong odor?
Yes, very strong. Call the gas company immediately and have them respond.
Okay, we’ll send somebody out. Thank you.
Bye.
Bye.
There's a very strong natural gas smell. We should have one of these cruisers or fire trucks check it out.
Okay, we’ll send somebody out immediately. New England gas emergency has been notified.
Engine 6 to control. We can hear it.
New England gas emergency, how can I help you?
Hi, we've got a confirmed leak from the fire department.
Is it a confirmed leak from the fire department? We will respond to that.
Yes, it’s confirmed, and they can hear it hissing. We're sending someone right over.
Thank you.
You're welcome.
Yes, I live at the intersection of Ronsville.
There's a noticeable natural gas smell. The fire department is on scene on New York Avenue.
No, I live on Cliff. Should I be concerned?
I'll send the fire department up to your location to check it out. It’s better to be safe.
Thank you. I didn’t want to dial 911, but I think most of my neighbors have natural gas, and I just stepped out the front door and it’s really obvious.
We’ll send someone right now. Stay safe.
Thanks a lot.
